question: Which of the following is a weed killer?
explanation:
• Insecticide is used against insects.
• Methyl salicylate topical is used for temporary relief of muscle or joint pain caused by strains, sprains, arthritis, bruising, or backaches. Methyl salicylate topical may also be used for purposes not listed in this medication guide.
• Herbicide is a substance that is toxic to plants, used to destroy unwanted vegetation.
